passage_text: WHAT IS HAND DANCE/DANCING/DANCER? In Washington, D.C., HAND DANCE was performed in the black and white communities in the 1950s to, mostly, Motown music. The dance has always been and still is danced by all races, cultures, genders, and ages of people. Hand dance is the official dance of the District of Columbia.

Hand dancing. Not to be confused with Hand jive. Hand dancing, also known as D.C. hand dancing or D.C. swing, is a form of swing dance that can be traced as far back as the 1920s, from Lindy Hop, to Jitterbug and to the 50s when Washington, D.C. developed its own version and named it Hand Dance.

I initiated and taught, with the help of some of my peers, a social hand dance class from 2003-2007 in my community in Hyattsville, Maryland. Hand dance/dancing/dancer is a partnership (male/female) style dance distinguished by the motions of the male's hand and received by the female's hand to follow his lead.

The National Hand Dance Association is sponsoring a workshop So You Want To Be A Hand Dance DJ. This FREE workshop is the beginning of introducing new and younger DJs in playing hand dance music which would appeal to a younger generation of hand dancers. This is a hands-on session with professional DJ equipment.
The National Hand Dance Association (NHDA) works to continue the 50 year legacy of Hand Dance.

To perform the dance, there are eight basic steps to learn. 1  The dance is performed in time with the chorus portion of the song, and is as follows: 2  Put Right hand out straight, palm down. They dance together with the other Cheerios during Mercedes and Kurt's performance of 4 Minutes, pairing up for a couple dance moves.antana approaches her, asking her what this is all about. Brittany tells her that this is her sole creative outlet now and Santana says that's not what Brittany really loves to do, that she loves to dance. Then Santana tries to help her and suggests a dance performance for Glee club, but Brittany refuses.

Participatory dance, on the other hand, whether it be a folk dance, a social dance, a group dance such as a line, circle, chain or square dance, or a partner dance such as is common in western Western ballroom dancing, is undertaken primarily for a common purpose, such as social interaction or exercise, of participants rather than onlookers.

Jazz hands. Jazz hands in performance dance is the extension of a performer's hands with palms toward the audience and fingers splayed (this position is also referred to as webbing). It is commonly associated with especially exuberant types of performance such as musicals, cheerleading, show choir, revue, and especially jazz dance shows.
